articles.content: New York City is no stranger to high-profile criminal trials, but few defendants have presented the challenges posed by Mexican drug lord Joaquín El Chapo Guzmán, one of the most infamous criminals in modern history. Opening statements in Mr. Guzmáns trial wi… [+7437 chars]

articles.title: The Wall Street Journal: Democrat Kyrsten Sinema wins Flake’s Arizona Senate seat
articles.description: Rep. Kyrsten Sinema won Arizona’s Senate contest, becoming the state’s first Democrat in 30 years to win Senate election.
articles.content: Rep. Kyrsten Sinema won Arizonas Senate contest, becoming the states first Democrat in 30 years to win Senate election. The Associated Press on Monday declared Sinema the winner over Republican Rep. Martha McSally following a tight race that took about a week… [+623 chars]

articles.title: The Wall Street Journal: Google network traffic briefly rerouted through Russia, China, Nigeria
articles.description: Google services were temporarily unreachable for some users after some traffic intended to reach the web giant was rerouted through other networks.

articles.title: Palmer Luckey on Google Pulling Out of Project Maven
articles.description: Oculus VR co-founder Palmer Luckey discusses Google’s recent move to withdraw from its contract with Project Maven. He spoke at Town Hall at the WSJ Tech D.Live in Laguna Beach, Calif. on Monday.

articles.title: The Wall Street Journal: Jerome Corsi says he expects to be indicted by Mueller investigation
